quoteFirst: Like Venus, keeps near the sun during the entire month, rising on the 1st at
quoteLast: ; on the 16th, at 3:43 a. m., and on the 30th, at 3:25 a. m., and setting on the corresponding days at 5:22, 5:21, and 5:19 p. m. respectively. His diameter is 4.4″, and his motion 22° 14′ 33.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, May 1885, No. 8
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
